contentrichtext.text: :''For the town in Armenia, see [[Yelpin]]. For the geographical region of southern Italy, see [[Irpinia]].'' {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Irpin |other_name = Ірпiнь<br>Ирпе́нь |image_skyline = Irpin city center.JPG |image_caption = Irpin city center |image_flag = |image_shield = Irpingerb.gif | pushpin_map = | pushpin_map1 = Ukraine Kiev Oblast |shield_size = 110px |image_map = |map_caption = Map of the Kyievo-Sviatoshynskyi Raion with Irpin. |coordinates_region = UA |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = {{UKR}} |subdivision_type1 = [[Oblast]] |subdivision_name1 = [[File:Flag of Kyiv Oblast.png|23px|border]] [[Kiev Oblast|Kiev]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Municipality]] |subdivision_name2 = Irpin city |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = Founded |established_date = 1899 |established_title2 = City rights |established_date2 = 1956 |area_total_km2 = 0.111 |population_as_of = 2002 |population_total = 41,762 |population_metro = 100,390<sup>1</sup> |population_density_km2 = 360.460 |timezone = EET |utc_offset = +2 |timezone_DST = EEST |utc_offset_DST = +3 |latd=50 |latm=31 |lats=00 |latNS=N |longd=30 |longm=15 |longs=00 |longEW=E |elevation_m = |postal_code_type = Postal code |postal_code = 08200 — 08279 |area_code = +380 4597 |website = http://www.irpin-rada.org/ |footnotes = <sup>1</sup> The metro population for Irpin are the statistics for the whole Irpin City Rada. }} '''Irpin''' ({{lang-uk|Ірпі́нь}}), or '''Irpen''' ({{lang-ru|Ирпе́нь}}) is a city located on the [[Irpin River]] in [[Kiev Oblast]] ([[oblast|province]]) of northern [[Ukraine]]. The city's population is 40,275 (as of 2006). The city houses a railway station, built in 1899.{{Citation needed|date=April 2009}} From 2003, the "[http://kinofest.g-2b.com/index-eng.html Irpen Film Festival]" for alternative cinematography takes place every year. ==History== Irpin was first founded in 1899, during construction of the [[Kiev]]—[[Kovel]] railway line. Railway workers founded the town near the railway road along with other localities such as [[Bucha, Ukraine|Bucha]] and [[Vorzel]]. The city's name (along with the city of Vorzel) was chosen due to its location on the [[Irpin River]]. In 1956, Irpin's status was changed to that of a "city of raion (district) subordinance," subordinate to the [[Kiev-Sviatoshyn Raion]] ([[raion|district]]). On December 30, 1962, the [[Verkhovna Rada|Presidium of the Verkhovna Rada]] of the [[Ukrainian SSR]] issued a decree changing the status of Irpin to that of a "city of oblast subordinance," thus being directly subordinate to the oblast authorities rather than the city administration housed within the city. Also mentioned within the decree were the inclusion of the [[urban-type settlement]]s of [[Bucha, Ukraine|Bucha]] (a city since 2007), [[Vorzel]], [[Hostomel]], and [[Kotsiubynske]] within the city limits. ==Economy== The "Irpintormash" factory, providing construction materials, and a furniture factory are located in the city. The city also houses a climate [[resort]]. Irpin's agricultural sector provides the capital of Ukraine, Kiev, with [[potato]]es and other vegetables. ==Famous people of Irpin== Famous Soviet writer [[Nikolay Nosov]] spent his childhood in this city. The famous Ukrainian photographer [[Yuri Kosin]] works in Irpin. ==External links== * [http://www.irpin-rada.org http://www.irpin-rada.org] — Irpin city administration * [http://www.kyiv-obl.gov.ua/viewradi.php3?m=62&rm=2 kyiv-obl.gov.ua] — Irpin on Kiev Oblast Administration site * [http://kinofest.g-2b.com/index-eng.html http://kinofest.g-2b.com/index-eng.html] - Irpen Film Festival * [http://www.irpin.in.ua/ http://www.irpin.in.ua/] - City Irpen portal {{Kiev Oblast}} {{Coord|50|31|N|30|15|E|type:city_region:UA|display=title}} [[Category:Cities in Kiev Oblast]]
